sentences.en: an area with a high incidence of crime
Commonly a sporadic disease, actinobacillocis occasionally occurs in high incidence.
sentences.cn: 该病通常是一种散发性疾病, 但偶尔也有高的发病率.

sentences.en: His estimate of half a million HIV positive cases was based on an extrapolation of the known incidence of the virus.
sentences.cn: 他估计有50万个HIV阳性病例，这是根据已知的病毒感染率作出的推论。

sentences.en: Hypertension has been reported with widely varying incidence in embryonal nephroma.
sentences.cn: 据报导,高血压伴有胚胎性肾瘤的发病率变动极大.

sentences.en: It was noted that within a year the incidence of illness had increased quite significantly.
sentences.cn: 据观察一年之内发病率显著上升。

sentences.en: Naturally, the expression for oblique incidence is more complicated.
sentences.cn: 倾斜入射的公式当然要更复杂些.

sentences.en: Orchards should not be established in areas with high rust - incidence.
sentences.cn: 果园不应设立在锈病率发生高的地区.

sentences.en: The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection.
The change in smoking is paralleled by a change in the incidence of lung cancer.
sentences.cn: 吸烟情况的变化与肺癌发病率的变化如影随形。

sentences.en: The incidence of breast cancer increases with age.
sentences.cn: 乳腺癌的发病率随着年龄的增长而上升。

sentences.en: The incidence of various contagious diseases has markedly dropped.
sentences.cn: 各种传染病的发病率大幅度下降.

sentences.en: The report analyses the incidence of cancer among people aged 0 - 24.
sentences.cn: 这份报告分析了从0 岁 到24岁的人的癌症发病率.

sentences.en: There the incidence of the cancer of the esophagus was suspected to be pretty high.
sentences.cn: 估计那里的食道癌发病率相当高。

sentences.en: There the incidence of the cancer of the oesophagus was suspected to be pretty high.
sentences.cn: 估计那里的食道癌发病率相当高.

sentences.en: There's still a high incidence of malaria in the area.
sentences.cn: 这一地区疟疾的患病率仍然很高.

sentences.en: This area has a high incidence of crime, disease, unemployment, etc.
sentences.cn: 这个地区的犯罪率 、 发病率 、 失业率等很高.

words.tran_cn: [光] 入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的
附带的；偶然的；容易发生的
附带事件；偶然事件；杂项
发生率；影响；[光]入射；影响范围

phrases.tran_cn: 掠入射；切线入射；临界入射
正入射；垂直入射；法线入射

trans.tran_cn: 发生率，影响范围，[数]关联，接合，[物]入射，入射角
trans.tran_en: the number of times something happens, especially crime, disease etc
